instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All rails present, fan spins, no display, doesn't boot, CPU not getting hot
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All rails present, fan spins, no display, doesn't boot, CPU not getting hot[/PLAIN]

Hi there,

I have a water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I replaced a bunch of corroded components, repaired some traces, and I'm getting a fan spin, but no chime, no display, no boot.

I have all rails present, including VCORE, but the CPU doesn't heat up at all.

I assume I'm looking at a dead CPU here? Or is there something else I might have overlooked?

Thanks in advance,
Bruce

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All rails present, fan spins, no display, doesn't boot, CPU not getting hot
threads.message: Try a donor bios just to check, but double check all your clock / BIOS lines continuities and pullups.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All rails present, fan spins, no display, doesn't boot, CPU not getting hot
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All rails present, fan spins, no display, doesn't boot, CPU not getting hot
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> All rails present, fan spins, no display, doesn't boot, CPU not getting hot
threads.message:
Thank you, that's what it was. There was a nice, big, juicy bit of corrosion under pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>. Cleaned up, replaced and it's booting beautifully. The post can be closed now.

This subscription is worth every cent.

Many thanks,
Bruce
